Title: (Senior) Applied AI/ML Scientist (f/m/d): Structured Enterprise Data
Description:
We help the world run better

At SAP, we enable you to bring out your best. Our company culture is focused on collaboration and a shared passion to help the world run better. How? We focus every day on building the foundation for tomorrow and creating a workplace that embraces differences, values flexibility, and is aligned to our purpose-driven and future-focused work. We offer a highly collaborative, caring team environment with a strong focus on learning and development, recognition for your individual contributions, and a variety of benefit options for you to choose from.

What you`ll do

Summary

At SAP, we integrate AI technology with extensive industry-specific data and deep process knowledge to create innovative AI capabilities for all SAP applications. Large Language Models (LLMs) hold immense potential to change the way we work and develop products. They are reshaping the landscape of Machine Learning across various domains. However, their limited ability to leverage tabular data leaves a considerable share of enterprise data untapped. It is SAP's mission to overcome this challenge within the realm of Business AI. Our goal is to adapt Foundation Models to SAP data, enabling our clients to solve their business processes more effectively.

The Role


Unique opportunity to develop a Foundation Model on structured business data.
Collaborate with senior AI scientists to develop and finetune Foundation Models for use cases on structured data.
Design and implement scalable pipelines and models, address open challenges to process and analyze large-scale structured datasets efficiently.
Conduct experiments and perform rigorous evaluations to measure the performance and effectiveness of the developed models.
Optimize and fine-tune models to improve accuracy, scalability, and interpretability.
Stay up to date with the latest advancements in the field of Deep Learning, Foundational Models, and Generative AI.


What You Bring


Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence, or other relevant disciplines. PhD is a plus.
Professional experience with Deep Learning on structured data, Foundation Models, and Transformer Models with their application for use cases in a business context.
Deep understanding of Machine Learning algorithms and techniques, particularly in the context of structured data.
Proficiency in Python and experience with ML frameworks such as PyTorch, TensorFlow, or similar.
Ideally, professional experience with Machine Learning on structured data such as in the ERP or CRM domain.
Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in cross-cultural teams.


Meet your team

SAP's AI organization is dedicated to seamlessly infusing AI into all enterprise applications, enabling customers, partners, and developers to enhance business processes and generate remarkable business value. Join our international AI team where innovation thrives, opportunities for personal development abound, and exceptional colleagues collaborate globally

#SAPBusinessAICareers #SAPAICareers

Bring out your best

SAP innovations help more than four hundred thousand customers worldwide work together more efficiently and use business insight more effectively. Originally known for leadership in enterprise resource planning (ERP) software, SAP has evolved to become a market leader in end-to-end business application software and related services for database, analytics, intelligent technologies, and experience management. As a cloud company with two hundred million users and more than one hundred thousand employees worldwide, we are purpose-driven and future-focused, with a highly collaborative team ethic and commitment to personal development. Whether connecting global industries, people, or platforms, we help ensure every challenge gets the solution it deserves. At SAP, you can bring out your best.

We win with inclusion

SAP’s culture of inclusion, focus on health and well-being, and flexible working models help ensure that everyone – regardless of background – feels included and can run at their best. At SAP, we believe we are made stronger by the unique capabilities and qualities that each person brings to our company, and we invest in our employees to inspire confidence and help everyone realize their full potential. We ultimately believe in unleashing all talent and creating a better and more equitable world.

SAP is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to the values of Equal Employment Opportunity and provide accessibility accommodations to applicants with physical and/or mental disabilities. If you are interested in applying for employment with SAP and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to Recruiting Operations Team: Careers@sap.com.

For SAP employees: Only permanent roles are eligible for the SAP Employee Referral Program, according to the eligibility rules set in the SAP Referral Policy. Specific conditions may apply for roles in Vocational Training.

Requisition ID: 401884 | Work Area: Software-Design and Development | Expected Travel: 0 - 10% | Career Status: Professional | Employment Type: Regular Full Time |

Title: Senior Data Scientist, Campaigns
Description:
We are looking for an experienced Senior Data Scientist to help us improve Bolt’s Campaigns

About Us

Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 150 million customers in 50+ countries. We’re a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission – to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!

About The Role

You will be building models for predicting the probability of the user booking under specific circumstances. You will work on customer segmentation: discover rider, driver, and eater segments for efficient campaign targeting. As a Data Scientist, you will be developing a system for automating promo campaigns setup and scaling it for millions of Bolt customers. You will be engaged in designing optimal experimental setup for comparing different campaigns targeting methodologies and user behavior dynamics. You will work on prioritising user acquisition channels using analytical and machine learning approaches.

Your daily adventures will include:


Machine learning and statistical model development and its deployment into a production environment)
Studying historical user behaviour and building models for optimal users’ discount allocation
Developing a system for automating regular promo campaign setups)
Setting up A/B tests, collecting, interpreting its results, and communicating to stakeholders)
Working with a technical stack consisting of Python, Docker, Presto, SageMaker, Airflow)
Collaborating with data analysts, data scientists, product managers, and software engineers in feature teams )



About you:


Industry experience in data science and machine learning (4+ years recommended), with deep knowledge of statistics, probability, and causal inference
Proficient in setting A/B tests and interpreting results, with a strong understanding of statistical hypothesis testing
Track record of deploying models to production and effectively measuring their impact
Experience in writing complex SQL queries and mapping business/product problems to data science frameworks
Strong product thinking and problem-solving skills, with the ability to communicate, persuade, and collaborate effectively
Proactive, self-driven mindset, able to take initiative with minimal supervision and work well in a team



Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don’t tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you’re the kind of person described above!

Why you’ll love it here:


Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.
Impact millions of customers and partners in 600+ cities across 50+ countries.
Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.
Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.
Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.
Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode with a minimum of 2 days in the office each week to foster strong connections and teamwork.
Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.
Some perks may differ depending on your location and role.

Title: AI Engineer - Freelance
Description:

Client: SaaS Company
Location: Remote (Germany)
Duration: 6 months or longer
Language: German proficiency required




Responsibilities:

Enhance AI innovation and delivery capacities for the organization.
Develop prototypes in data science and data engineering.
Oversee general continuous integration and development processes.
Act as a technical consultant during client interactions.

Proficiency in Data Engineering, with hands-on experience in Databricks, Spark, and Kafka.
Strong knowledge and practical experience in AI technologies and solutions.
Passion for technology and its advancements.

Notes: This is a remote position based in Germany, with a duration of at least 6 months. Fluency in German is essential for effective communication. Title: Machine Learning Scientist Bio Modelling (all Genders)
Description:
At Bayer we’re visionaries, driven to solve the world’s toughest challenges and striving for a world where ,Health for all, Hunger for none’ is no longer a dream, but a real possibility. We’re doing it with energy, curiosity and sheer dedication, always learning from unique perspectives of those around us, expanding our thinking, growing our capabilities and redefining ‘impossible’. There are so many reasons to join us. If you’re hungry to build a varied and meaningful career in a community of brilliant and diverse minds to make a real difference, there’s only one choice.

Machine Learning Scientist Bio Modelling (all Genders)

Develop innovative machine learning solutions to analyze biomedical datasets of different modalities with the goal of designing optimized molecules and improving our understanding of targets, diseases and patients.

Your Tasks And Responsibilities


Be an active member of a highly interdisciplinary and cross-organizational team
You will develop and evaluate state-of-the-art machine learning algorithms applied to modelling protein-ligand and protein-protein complexes
You will collaborate with cross-functional teams throughout R&D to ensure innovative algorithmic solutions are operationalized and integrated into our discovery pipelines
You will keep up to date with the latest advances in machine learning technologies
You will engage with the broader scientific community through publications, open-source projects, and conference presentations


Who You Are

We are excited about your talent and passion for this position. Attracting the right talent is important to us. We would be happy to work with you to identify and create the career and development opportunities you are looking for - also in parttime. And if you don't meet all the requirements, we still look forward to receiving your application. We are all constantly learning!

Required:


You have a highly scientific or engineering background, with a PhD degree or equivalent
You have expertise in machine learning research
You have a sincere interest for drug discovery and the life sciences
You have excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Preferred:


You have expertise in bioinformatics or structural biology
You are an expert in applying machine learning for characterizing and designing small molecules, DNA/RNA, or proteins
You have expertise in applying, dissecting, and improving upon state-of-the-art machine learning methods. Knowledge of modern generative modelling methods (e.g., diffusion), protein language models (e.g., ESM), modern structure prediction methods (e.g., AlphaFold), or experience efficiently training and fine-tuning large models are a big plus
You have excellent software engineering skills
You have a strong publication record or demonstrated contributions (e.g., open source) for the above


What We Offer

Our benefits package is flexible, appreciative, and tailored to your lifestyle, because: What matters to you, matters to us!


We ensure your financial stability through a competitive compensation package, consisting of an attractive base pay and our annual bonus. In addition, managers can recognize special contributions by granting an individual performance award or top performance award.
Whether it’s hybrid work models or part-time arrangements: Whenever it is possible, you will have the flexibility to work how, when and where it is best for you.
Your family is a top priority. We offer loving company daycare centers at multiple locations, support in finding childcare, time off for the care of elderly or dependent family members, summer camps for children, and much more.
We support your professional growth by providing access to learning and development opportunities, training programs through the Bayer Learning Academy, development dialogues, as well as coaching and mentoring programs.
We promote health awareness and opportunities for selfcare through various measures, such as free health checks with the company doctor and our health platform #machfit.
We embrace diversity by providing an inclusive work environment in which you are welcomed, supported, and encouraged to bring your whole self to work.


The position is limited to two years.

Our target date to fill the position is 01.01.2025 (negotiable).

Be You. Be Bayer.

Pharmaceuticals

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer (MRI)
Description:
Position Overview: We are seeking a Senior MRI Scientist with expertise in Machine Learning to drive innovation in MRI data acquisition, analysis, and interpretation. This role involves developing machine learning models to enhance MRI performance, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and improving diagnostic outcomes. Key Responsibilities: Lead the development of machine learning models for MRI image reconstruction, denoising, and artifact reduction. Apply AI for MRI data analysis (e.g., segmentation, classification, quantitative imaging). Collaborate with clinical researchers and engineers to integrate AI into MRI workflows. Design novel MRI techniques to accelerate scanning and improve image quality. Stay current with advancements in machine learning and MRI; contribute to publications and conferences. Qualifications: PhD in Biomedical Engineering, Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, or related field. 3+ years of experience in MRI research; 3+ years in machine learning applications. Proficiency in Python, TensorFlow, or PyTorch; experience in medical image processing. Strong background in MRI physics and image reconstruction. Proven track record of scientific publications and experience with clinical applications. You have strong coding skills in Python and C/C++ You have experience with MR pulse sequence development and imaging optimization Preferred: Experience with 3D medical imaging, high-performance computing, and GPU-based training. Familiarity with FDA regulations and MRI hardware. Benefits: Comprehensive salary Long term incentives 25+ days holiday Clear development pathway If you are interested in this role then be sure to contact Aimee Greatorex, a specialist AI Recruiter who will discuss the opportunity with you in detail. She will be more than happy to answer any questions relating to the industry and the potential for your career growth. The conversation can also progress further to discussing other opportunities, which are also available right now or will be imminently becoming available. This position has been highly popular, and it is likely that it will close prematurely. We recommend applying as soon as possible to avoid disappointment. Aimee Greatorex Recruitment Consultant – Barrington James Email: agreatorex@barringtonjames.com

Title: Senior Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
Role Overview: My client, an innovative MedTech startup, is seeking a talented Senior Machine Learning Engineer with a specialisation in Large Language Models (LLMs) to join their team. In this fully remote role, you will lead the development of advanced AI solutions specifically designed for the healthcare sector. Your work will directly contribute to enhancing patient care, optimising medical processes, and driving innovation in medical research. Key Responsibilities:


Create, train, and deploy state-of-the-art LLMs (e.g., GPT-4, BERT, T5) to tackle complex healthcare challenges such as clinical data analysis, patient communication, and medical research.
Stay updated with the latest advancements in machine learning and NLP, applying this knowledge to develop cutting-edge healthcare solutions.
Partner with healthcare professionals, data scientists, and engineers to integrate LLM solutions into healthcare platforms and applications.
Ensure model performance and scalability by optimising algorithms for real-time healthcare applications and maintaining high standards of accuracy and efficiency.
Mentor and guide junior engineers, fostering a culture of innovation and excellence in AI-driven healthcare solutions. What They’re Looking For:
Minimum of 5 years of experience in machine learning, with a strong focus on LLMs and NLP.
3+ years of experience with Langchain and Llama Index.
Proficiency in Python and key ML frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch). A deep understanding of transformer architectures and fine-tuning techniques is essential.
Demonstrated ability to apply advanced ML techniques to solve complex healthcare problems and drive advancements in medical technology.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders, including healthcare professionals. Why Join My Client?
Contribute to the exciting field of healthcare technology and help enhance patient care with innovative AI solutions that truly make an impact.
Enjoy the freedom of a fully remote work environment and flexible hours that let you balance your professional and personal life seamlessly.
Take advantage of ongoing learning opportunities and career development in a rapidly growing sector that’s making a real difference.
Become part of a supportive and inclusive team that values creativity, diversity, and a shared commitment to excellence in healthcare innovation. Salary Range: Competitive salary between €80,000 - €100,000, commensurate with experience.

Title: Head of Data Science (f/m/x)
Description:
Company Description

We are seeking a technically skilled Head of Data Science to join our dynamic Data Science department at AUTO1 Group Technology. As part of our disruptive approach in the used car market, our team leverages advanced machine learning techniques to drive innovation and enhance our platforms and processes. AUTO1 Group is Europe's leading digital automotive platform. We revolutionize the used car market with our well-known brands Autohero, wirkaufendeinauto.de, and AUTO1.com.

Your new Role


Drive the development and deployment of impactful machine learning models that deliver business results.
Work closely with Data Science Team Leads to oversee the development of various machine learning topics, ensuring resources are allocated effectively and projects stay on track.
Provide technical expertise and guidance to team members, offering advice on modeling questions and making critical MLOps design choices.
Motivate and inspire team members to reach their maximum potential, attracting and retaining top talent.
Collaborate with stakeholders and partners in the tech department to identify and capitalize on business opportunities.
Advocate best practices in processes, coding standards, and technologies within the data science department.


Your Skills


Proven experience in managing teams or departments, with a focus on technical guidance and mentorship.
Demonstrated track record of generating substantial business impact through successful development and deployment of machine learning models.
Profound knowledge of predictive machine learning models, software engineering practices, and machine learning operations.
Experience or quick adaptability to our tech stack, including Python, AWS services (Step Functions, Glue, Sagemaker & Sagemaker Python SDK, Redshift, etc.), Jenkins, Terraform, FastAPI and SQL.
Strong business understanding and the ability to draw meaningful conclusions from A/B test experiments, providing relevant insights to stakeholders.


Our Offer

Our offer


Colleagues who strive for excellence and utilize the latest technologies. See what we do in our Tech-Blog: https://auto1.tech.
Our dynamic environment offers new challenges for personal growth and encourages the contribution of your own ideas.
More than 100 different nationalities contribute to a truly international and diverse working environment.
30 days of vacation per year.
Educational budget to support your continuous learning and development.
Discounts at Autohero, our platform for high-quality used cars.


Apply by uploading your CV with a note of your earliest starting date.

Contact

Lina Antoniuk

At AUTO1 Group we live an open culture, believe in direct communication, and value diversity. We welcome every applicant; regardless of gender, ethnic origin, religion, age, sexual identity, disability, or any other non-merit factor.

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Digital Marketing
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

At Vinted, our Digital Marketing Data Science & Analytics team is pivotal in driving growth through data-driven decision-making and enabling high-stake investment decisions. This team comprises talented individuals with backgrounds in academia, econometrics, e-commerce, consulting, and media. They use scientific approaches to solve complex business problems, develop statistical and business models, perform advanced data analyses, and ensure data reliability.

Within Marketing, we currently have exciting opportunities for Decision Scientists to work with either CRM or Performance Marketing teams.

Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) department we have three distinct roles. We believe that each role can make a similarly sized business impact in different ways and therefore our salary ranges are the same for all three roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation – translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.


In this position, you’ll


Set up untracked marketing experiments: Use Geo experiments, causal impact, or diff-in-diff methodologies to measure the incremental impact of different marketing channels and campaigns
Experimentation: Analyse AB tests and iterate on the experiment set up and automated testing tools
Revenue Stream Analysis: Investigate revenue streams generated by marketing, including acquisition, reactivation, and engagement.
Marketing Channel Analysis: Assess the impact of various marketing channels on user acquisition, retention, engagement, and revenue.
Support Media Mix Modeling: Occasionally assist with ad-hoc requests, including data questions, consultations, and analyses.
Segmentation: Develop unique personas to enable relevant and personalised comms to millions of Vinted users
Analytical deep dives: answer complex questions such as: when is the best time to reach out to our customers? What is the best mix of different messages and amount of communications? What is the total impact of all communications?


About You

General Requirements:


Several years of experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Data Scientist, or similar role.
Strong business results orientation with the ability to connect scientific approaches with pragmatic problem-solving.
Excellent communication skills to present results persuasively to various stakeholders.
Proficiency in at least one statistical programming language (R, Python, Stata, Matlab, etc.)
Fluency in SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau).
A graduate degree in statistics, econometrics, economics, business, or a related field.
Excellent written and spoken English.


Nice To Have Skills (not All Necessary)


Strong experimentation knowledge from CRM or Product background;
Good understanding of performance marketing channels attribution;
Causal inference and geo experimentation experience


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to €540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You’ll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We’ve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It’s up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you’ll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is € 57,000 - € 77,100 gross per year.

Title: Data Scientist - German Speaking
Description:
Data Scientist - Project Lead

Salary: 75k - 80k

We're hiring for a Data Scientist Project Lead to join an innovative Machine Learning consultancy and be a key player in supporting reputable companies across Europe to become leaders in AI. This company specialize in partnering with big corporations to build their AI/Data projects, providing end-to-end solutions to meet their business needs.

As a Customer-Facing Data Scientist Project Lead, you will be at the forefront of their mission to drive AI innovation. You will collaborate with prominent companies, leading the charge in developing and deploying large language models, and working closely with engineering, product teams, and various stakeholders.

Experience in LLMs / MLOps is nice to have but not mandatory

We're happy for folks to upskill. We're looking for good customer-facing skills and Data Science skills, this is a hands on technical role.

The role is hybrid 2-3 days a week in their office in Kreuzberg, but the first month of every quarter is fully remote so you can work wherever you like. The role does require German speaking skills.

Sound like it could be a good fit?

Please apply and we'll share the full details with you and organise a time to chat through the next steps
Show more
HTML:
Data Scientist - Project Lead

Salary: 75k - 80k

We're hiring for a Data Scientist Project Lead to join an innovative Machine Learning consultancy and be a key player in supporting reputable companies across Europe to become leaders in AI. This company specialize in partnering with big corporations to build their AI/Data projects, providing end-to-end solutions to meet their business needs.

As a Customer-Facing Data Scientist Project Lead, you will be at the forefront of their mission to drive AI innovation. You will collaborate with prominent companies, leading the charge in developing and deploying large language models, and working closely with engineering, product teams, and various stakeholders.

Experience in LLMs / MLOps is nice to have but not mandatory

We're happy for folks to upskill. We're looking for good customer-facing skills and Data Science skills, this is a hands on technical role.

The role is hybrid 2-3 days a week in their office in Kreuzberg, but the first month of every quarter is fully remote so you can work wherever you like. The role does require German speaking skills.

Sound like it could be a good fit?

Please apply and we'll share the full details with you and organise a time to chat through the next steps

Title: Lead Machine Learning Engineer
Description:
We’re seeking a Lead Machine Learning Engineer in Berlin (on-site) to join our small & fast-moving team. You’d own large parts of our Data Pipeline & ML Services which are built with Python & FastAPI while leveraging OpenAI Services from Azure.

About REMATIQ

We are a Berlin-based startup transforming how Medtech companies comply with regulations. Our AI-powered platform automates regulatory compliance throughout the product lifecycle, allowing our customers to focus on innovation.We’re tackling a critical problem in the industry, with the potential to significantly impact global health outcomes.

About The Role

As a Lead Machine Learning Engineer, you’ll own large part of our ML services and complete a team of 3 highly-skilled ML Engineers. You’ll make key technical decisions to optimize for speed of iteration, data quality and model performance.What you will be working on:


Developing our core data pipelines & ML services.
Owning ML-based features end-to-end from the first prototype to the final delivery.
Balancing high-quality & performant code while shipping quickly.
Contributing to product strategy and roadmap planning.
Driving technical decisions across our ML stack.


What we are looking for?


Experienced ML Engineer with strong data science & python skills.
Proven track record of shipping ML-based products in a fast-paced environments, ideally from the earliest stages.
Ability to ship quickly and breaking down complex problems into small & modular solutions.
Exceptional problem-solving abilities & communication skills.
Passion for our mission and excitement about revolutionizing an old-school industry with AI.


Bonus Points For Experience With


Document-based data pipelines.
Natural Language Processing.
Web scraping.
Startups, especially in founding roles.
The life sciences or regulatory compliance sectors


Why is this a great opportunity?


Join a small, ambitious team with real ownership and unparalleled growth opportunities
Work with experienced founders who know how to build successful companies
Collaborate with top talent in software engineering, ml & business.
Competitive compensation in both salary & equity
Work from our office in the heart of Berlin
Make a significant impact on an industry that directly affects global health


Rematiq is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We encourage applications from all individuals, regardless of background, and are committed to fostering a workplace where everyone feels respected, valued, and supported.

Title: Principal Data Scientist
Description:
Cint is a pioneer in research technology (ResTech). Our customers use the Cint platform to post questions and get answers from real people to build business strategies, confidently publish research, accurately measure the impact of digital advertising, and more. The Cint platform is built on a programmatic marketplace, which is the world’s largest, with nearly 300 million respondents in over 150 countries who consent to sharing their opinions, motivations, and behaviours.

We are feeding the world’s curiosity!

Job Description

Role Overview

As a Principal Data Scientist at Cint, you will lead advanced analytics and data science initiatives for Data Solutions and Media Measurement product lines. This role involves using statistical modeling, machine learning, large language models and advanced data analysis techniques. Ultimately, you will be accountable for developing and maintaining research methods that align Cint capabilities with market claims and industry standards of measurement. The ideal candidate will possess strong technical and thought leadership skills and will be comfortable working cross-functionally with product, engineers, and business stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities


Develop and deploy statistical models, machine learning algorithms, and custom analytics solutions to measure the effectiveness of media campaigns.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to design, refine and automate measurement methodologies for TV, digital, social, and other media platforms.
Lead the research and discovery phases for both new and existing products and partner closely with engineering teams to transition prototypes into robust, scalable solutions.
Develop customer-facing methodology resources and thought leadership. Support business teams in explaining and defending our measurement methodologies broadly to customers.
Independently plan, develop, and manage projects from concept to completion with no supervision, ensuring timely and high-quality delivery.
Partner with product teams and other stakeholders to translate business needs into actionable data science initiatives.
Serve as a technical leader and mentor to other data scientists in the team, promoting best practices in coding, experimentation, and analytical techniques.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and emerging methodologies in media measurement and data science.
Communicate complex results, insights and strategic recommendations to non-technical audiences through compelling data visualizations, detailed reports and presentations.


Qualifications

Qualifications:


Advanced degree (Ph.D. or Master's) in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or Computer Science with outstanding analytical expertise.
10+ years of experience in data science, analytics, or related fields, with at least 4 years focused on media measurement, marketing analytics, or advertising.
Proven track record in leading large-scale data science projects, mentoring teams, driving strategy and delivering business impact.
Extensive experience in advanced statistical techniques and concepts (e.g., multivariate testing, sampling theory, weighting/projection, experimental design, regression/predictive modeling, causal inference techniques).
Strong programming skills in Python (as statistical and ML package tools).
Proven expertise in advanced Python prototyping.
Proficiency with machine learning libraries (e.g., scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch) and techniques (e.g., clustering, regression, decision-trees).
Advanced SQL skills and familiarity with big data technologies (Spark, Hadoop, Databricks).
Strong understanding of infrastructure cost management, particularly in relation to processing large datasets efficiently.


Preferred Qualifications


Experience in online survey methodologies.


Personal Attributes


Excellent communication skills and advanced presentation skills, with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to a large technical and non-technical audience.
Excellent interpersonal skills, able to work effectively with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.
Strong ability to analyze complex and large data sets and extract meaningful insights.
A genuine interest in exploring new data science methods, tools, and technologies to create and implement innovative solutions and approaches.


Additional Information

Our Values

Collaboration is our superpower


We uncover rich perspectives across the world.
Success happens together.


Innovation is in our blood


We’re pioneers in our industry.
Our curiosity is insatiable.
We bring the best ideas to life.


We Do What We Say


We’re accountable for our work and actions.
Excellence comes as standard.
We’re open, honest and kind, always.


We are caring


We learn from each other’s experiences.
Stop and listen; every opinion matters.
We embrace diversity, equity and inclusion.


More About Cint

In June 2021, Cint acquired Berlin-based GapFish – the world’s largest ISO certified online panel community in the DACH region – and in January 2022, completed the acquisition of US-based Lucid – a programmatic research technology platform that provides access to first-party survey data in over 110 countries.

Cint Group AB (publ), listed on Nasdaq Stockholm, this growth has made Cint a strong global platform with teams across its many global offices, including Stockholm, London, New York, New Orleans, Singapore, Tokyo and Sydney. (www.cint.com)

Title: Senior Data Scientist Generative AI (m/w/d) - Datenbankentwicklung/BI, Ingenieur
Description:
In einer digitalen Gesellschaft sind Daten die wichtigste Ressource, um den großen Herausforderungen wie Klimawandel, gesellschaftliche Teilhabe und Nachhaltigkeit zu begegnen. Die Bereiche Gesundheitsvorsorge, Mobilität, Energie- und Ressourceneffizienz und Umweltschutz können dabei von der Datennutzung überproportional profitieren. Bei der Bereitstellung und Verarbeitung großer, verteilter Datenmengen kommen innovative Technologien, wie Cloud-Computing, Internet of Things, Big Data und Künstliche Intelligenz zur Anwendung. Die mit diesen Daten und Technologien verbundenen Chancen und Potentiale für datengetriebene Geschäftsmodelle und Anwendungen zu heben, bestimmt das Handeln in Unternehmen und Behörden in der Digitalen Datenökonomie der Zukunft. Daher arbeiten unsere interdisziplinären Teams tagtäglich intensiv daran unsere Kunden aus Wirtschaft und Verwaltung eine optimale Wertschöpfung der Daten zu bieten. Hierzu setzen wir durch künstliche Intelligenz gesteuerte Applikationen ein, um Bevölkerungs- und Katastrophenschutz, Mobilitätsdatenplattformen sowie Smart Citys in die digitale Zukunft zu führen. Werde auch du Teil unserer digitalen Erfolgsgeschichte und komm als Data Scientist Generative AI (m/w/d) zu uns an Bord! Data Scientist Generative AI (m/w/d) Als Data Scientist Generative AI bei Materna konzeptionierst und entwickelst du hoch performante Data Analytics- und Machine Learning-Lösungen und setzt diese in unseren spannenden Projekten um. entwirfst und implementierst du innovative Anwendungen im Bereich der generativen KI, wie z.B. automatisierte Textgenerierung, Bilderkennung und -bearbeitung, um neue Geschäftsmöglichkeiten und Effizienzsteigerungen zu erschließen. berätst du unsere Partner zu Themen rund um die künstliche Intelligenz und präsentierst die Ergebnisse unseren Auftraggebern. designst du skalierbare Data Analytics-Plattformen und Komponenten, richtest sie ein und betreust diese. entwickelst du die KI-Strategie weiter und kooperierst mit anderen Materna-Geschäftsbereichen, um neue Data Analytics und Machine Learning-Anwendungsfälle zu identifizieren. führst du Schulungen im Bereich Data Science durch. Das bringst du mit Ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Studium mit Schwerpunkt (Wirtschafts-)Informatik, Mathematik, Physik o. Ä. Mehrjährige Erfahrungen mit Data Analytics oder Machine Learning-Projekten, idealerweise im öffentlichen Sektor Fundiertes Wissen über generative KI-Modelle, einschließlich aber nicht beschränkt auf Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs), Variational Autoencoders (VAEs) und Transformer-basierte Modelle für die Generierung von Text und Bildern. Praktische Erfahrung mit spezialisierten Tools und Frameworks für generative KI, wie z.B. OpenAI's GPT-Reihe, Google's BERT und T5, oder spezialisierte Bibliotheken wie PyTorch Lightning oder FastAI für generatives Deep Learning. Kenntnisse im Umgang mit großen Datensätzen und dem Training von ressourcenintensiven Modellen, einschließlich Optimierungstechniken zur Effizienzsteigerung. Erfahrung in der Anwendung generativer KI-Modelle in realen Szenarien, z.B. zur Inhaltsproduktion, Datenanreicherung, Anomalieerkennung oder zur Simulation und Vorhersage von Szenarien. Kreativität und Innovationsfähigkeit bei der Identifizierung und Umsetzung neuer Anwendungsfälle für generative KI in verschiedenen Branchen und Bereichen. Praktische Erfahrungen im maschinellen Lernen, z. B. in den Bereichen Natural Language Processing, Deep Learning, Bayesian Methods, logikbasiertes maschinelles Lernen oder Kernel Methods mit Anwendungen in der Analyse von strukturierten und unstrukturierten Daten Umfassende Erfahrung mit SQL, Python, R und andere relevante ML-Bibliotheken, idealerweise zudem Erfahrung mit TensorFlow, Keras, NLTK, Torch, Spark, Hadoop, Java EE, Kafka oder splunk Sehr gute Deutsch- sowie gute Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift Deine Vorteile Flexible Arbeitszeit ohne Kernarbeitszeit Mobiles Arbeiten Come-as-you-are-Mentalität Duz-Kultur und flache Hierarchien Events: Mal fachlich wie unsere Brown Bag Sessions und mal zwanglos bei unserer Weihnachtsfeier. Paten-Konzept für deine individuelle Einarbeitung Fahrradleasing mit JobRad Betriebliche Altersvorsorge

Title: Junior Entwickler (m/w/d)
Description:
Du bist auf der Suche nach einer spannenden und abwechslungsreichen Tätigkeit im Bereich Entwicklung und Automatisierung?

Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Bereich Programmierung sammeln können und großes Interesse an Entwicklung von Automatisierungsprozessen. Du bist bereit, deine technischen Fähigkeiten und dein Know-how in einem Umfeld zu entfalten, das Innovation und Dynamik täglich lebt - Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig! Wir sind ein innovatives Tech-Startup in Berlin mit einem dynamischen Team, das die Grenzen von Technologie und Kreativität optimiert. Unsere Expertise umfasst unter anderem Bereiche wie RPA, KI und IPaaS. Wir sind mehr als nur ein weiteres Tech-Unternehmen; wir sind eine Bewegung, die zur Disruption inspiriert und Unternehmen dabei aktiv fördert und unterstützt, ihre Arbeitsweisen effektiv zu transformieren. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Kunden entwickeln wir maßgeschneiderte Digitalisierungsstrategien und implementieren IT-Lösungen, die nicht nur den heutigen Anforderungen entsprechen, sondern auch die Arbeitswelt von morgen prägen. Bei deefinity steht alles im Zeichen der Innovation und des Erreichens außergewöhnlicher Erfolge.

Deine Aufgaben als Teil unseres Teams:


Entwicklung: Du entwirfst, entwickelst und implementierst IT-Lösungen zur Automatisierung von Geschäftsprozessen.
Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit: Du arbeitest eng mit unterschiedlichen Fachbereichen zusammen, um die Anforderungen an die Automatisierung zu verstehen und effektive Lösungen zu entwickeln.
Qualitätssicherung: Du führst Tests durch, behebst Fehler und optimierst, um eine hohe Qualität und Effizienz sicherzustellen.
Prozessdokumentation: Du unterstützt dein Team, indem du an Prozessaufnahmegesprächen teilnimmst und diese dokumentierst.
Persönliche Entwicklung: Du wirst von erfahrenen Entwicklern lernen und konstruktives Feedback erhalten, um Dich weiterzuentwickeln.


Requirements

Das bringst du mit :


Sprachen: Mindestens gute Deutsch- (C1) und Englischkenntnisse (C1)
Ausbildung: Universitäts- oder Fachhochschulabschluss mit Schwerpunkt Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder ein vergleichbarer Abschluss
Engagement: Stark ausgeprägtes agiles Mindset, eigener Drive neues zu lernen
Erfahrung: Gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit objektorientierten Programmiersprachen oder Automatisierungslösungen
Arbeitsweise: Verständnis für komplexe Prozesse und analytische sowie strukturierte Arbeitsweise
Einstellung: Teamgeist, Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Spaß an projektbezogener Arbeit


Pluspunkte:


Idealerweise Kenntnisse in einer oder mehreren objektorientierter Programmiersprachen (z.B. C#, Python, Java...)
Erfahrungen mit Skriptsprachen (z.B. VBS, JS) sowie Build-/Deployment Tools (z.B. Azure)
Kenntnisse im Bereich Robotic Process Automation (UiPath, BluePrism, AutomationAnywhere, PowerAutomate, Robocorp)
Kenntnisse moderner Architekturkonzepte, Design Patterns und agiler Softwareentwicklung (Scrum, Kanban)


Benefits


Flex-work: Wir schätzen Deine Work-Life-Balance! Genieße unsere flexiblen Arbeitszeiten (Gleitzeitkonto), unser Hybrid-Arbeitsmodell mit 3 Tagen im Office und 2 Tagen Home-Office, und die Möglichkeit, Dir freie Tage zu gönnen.
Salary & More: Bei uns bekommst Du ein attraktives Gehaltspaket, das durch Benefits wie Bonuszahlungen, Jobticket für Deine tägliche Mobilität und eine Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft für Deine Fitness und Freizeit ergänzt wird.
Personal & Professional Development: Entwickle Dich kontinuierlich weiter - ob interne Coachings oder externe Weiterbildungen – Du bekommst ständig neue Chancen, Dich weiterzuentwickeln. Unsere Trainingspfade sind auf Deine Rolle und Deine persönlichen Interessen abgestimmt. Unsere Angebote umfassen Lunch & Learn Sessions, Work-Life-Balance Coachings, Soft Skill Trainings, positionsspezifische Workshops, Zertifizierungen und Mentoring Programme – alles perfekt auf Deine Rolle und Interessen abgestimmt.
Work-Life-Balance: Wir bieten Dir 30 Urlaubstage, Möglichkeiten für Workations, Sabbaticals und Teilzeitoptionen. Damit findest Du den perfekten Ausgleich zwischen Beruf und Freizeit.
Team Feeling: Bei uns steht das Miteinander im Vordergrund. Wir fördern eine vielfältige und inklusive Unternehmenskultur, feiern gemeinsame Erfolge, und stärken unser Teamgefühl durch regelmäßige Team-Events, Team-Meetings und Team-Lunches.
Empowering Company Culture: Arbeite in einem zukunftsorientierten Unternehmen mit modernem Office im Herzen Berlins. Bei uns kannst Du Deine Ideen einbringen und umsetzen, dank flacher Hierarchien und schnellen Entscheidungswegen.
Broad Range of Projects: Tauche ein in eine Welt spannender, vielseitiger Projekte, die nicht nur Deine Verantwortungsbereiche erweitern, sondern auch sinnvoll und erfüllend sind. Bei uns findest Du Arbeit, die Sinn macht.
Fast Application Process: Erwarte einen schnellen Bewerbungsprozess mit umgehendem Feedback und regelmäßigen Status-Updates. Wir halten Dich auf dem Laufenden und schätzen Deine Zeit und Dein Engagement.
Warm Welcome & Structured Onboarding: Starte durch mit unserem strukturierten Onboarding-Prozess, inklusive Mentoring, Briefings und Welcome-Days. Wir sorgen dafür, dass Du Dich von Anfang an als Teil des Teams fühlst.
Show more
HTML:
Du bist auf der Suche nach einer spannenden und abwechslungsreichen Tätigkeit im Bereich Entwicklung und Automatisierung?

Du hast bereits Erfahrung im Bereich Programmierung sammeln können und großes Interesse an Entwicklung von Automatisierungsprozessen. Du bist bereit, deine technischen Fähigkeiten und dein Know-how in einem Umfeld zu entfalten, das Innovation und Dynamik täglich lebt - Dann bist du bei uns genau richtig! Wir sind ein innovatives Tech-Startup in Berlin mit einem dynamischen Team, das die Grenzen von Technologie und Kreativität optimiert. Unsere Expertise umfasst unter anderem Bereiche wie RPA, KI und IPaaS. Wir sind mehr als nur ein weiteres Tech-Unternehmen; wir sind eine Bewegung, die zur Disruption inspiriert und Unternehmen dabei aktiv fördert und unterstützt, ihre Arbeitsweisen effektiv zu transformieren. In enger Zusammenarbeit mit unseren Kunden entwickeln wir maßgeschneiderte Digitalisierungsstrategien und implementieren IT-Lösungen, die nicht nur den heutigen Anforderungen entsprechen, sondern auch die Arbeitswelt von morgen prägen. Bei deefinity steht alles im Zeichen der Innovation und des Erreichens außergewöhnlicher Erfolge.

Deine Aufgaben als Teil unseres Teams:

  • Entwicklung: Du entwirfst, entwickelst und implementierst IT-Lösungen zur Automatisierung von Geschäftsprozessen.
  • Interdisziplinäre Zusammenarbeit: Du arbeitest eng mit unterschiedlichen Fachbereichen zusammen, um die Anforderungen an die Automatisierung zu verstehen und effektive Lösungen zu entwickeln.
  • Qualitätssicherung: Du führst Tests durch, behebst Fehler und optimierst, um eine hohe Qualität und Effizienz sicherzustellen.
  • Prozessdokumentation: Du unterstützt dein Team, indem du an Prozessaufnahmegesprächen teilnimmst und diese dokumentierst.
  • Persönliche Entwicklung: Du wirst von erfahrenen Entwicklern lernen und konstruktives Feedback erhalten, um Dich weiterzuentwickeln.

Requirements

Das bringst du mit :

  • Sprachen: Mindestens gute Deutsch- (C1) und Englischkenntnisse (C1)
  • Ausbildung: Universitäts- oder Fachhochschulabschluss mit Schwerpunkt Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik, Mathematik, Physik oder ein vergleichbarer Abschluss
  • Engagement: Stark ausgeprägtes agiles Mindset, eigener Drive neues zu lernen
  • Erfahrung: Gute Kenntnisse im Umgang mit objektorientierten Programmiersprachen oder Automatisierungslösungen
  • Arbeitsweise: Verständnis für komplexe Prozesse und analytische sowie strukturierte Arbeitsweise
  • Einstellung: Teamgeist, Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Spaß an projektbezogener Arbeit

Pluspunkte:

  • Idealerweise Kenntnisse in einer oder mehreren objektorientierter Programmiersprachen (z.B. C#, Python, Java...)
  • Erfahrungen mit Skriptsprachen (z.B. VBS, JS) sowie Build-/Deployment Tools (z.B. Azure)
  • Kenntnisse im Bereich Robotic Process Automation (UiPath, BluePrism, AutomationAnywhere, PowerAutomate, Robocorp)
  • Kenntnisse moderner Architekturkonzepte, Design Patterns und agiler Softwareentwicklung (Scrum, Kanban)

Benefits

  • Flex-work: Wir schätzen Deine Work-Life-Balance! Genieße unsere flexiblen Arbeitszeiten (Gleitzeitkonto), unser Hybrid-Arbeitsmodell mit 3 Tagen im Office und 2 Tagen Home-Office, und die Möglichkeit, Dir freie Tage zu gönnen.
  • Salary & More: Bei uns bekommst Du ein attraktives Gehaltspaket, das durch Benefits wie Bonuszahlungen, Jobticket für Deine tägliche Mobilität und eine Urban Sports Club-Mitgliedschaft für Deine Fitness und Freizeit ergänzt wird.
  • Personal & Professional Development: Entwickle Dich kontinuierlich weiter - ob interne Coachings oder externe Weiterbildungen – Du bekommst ständig neue Chancen, Dich weiterzuentwickeln. Unsere Trainingspfade sind auf Deine Rolle und Deine persönlichen Interessen abgestimmt. Unsere Angebote umfassen Lunch & Learn Sessions, Work-Life-Balance Coachings, Soft Skill Trainings, positionsspezifische Workshops, Zertifizierungen und Mentoring Programme – alles perfekt auf Deine Rolle und Interessen abgestimmt.
  • Work-Life-Balance: Wir bieten Dir 30 Urlaubstage, Möglichkeiten für Workations, Sabbaticals und Teilzeitoptionen. Damit findest Du den perfekten Ausgleich zwischen Beruf und Freizeit.
  • Team Feeling: Bei uns steht das Miteinander im Vordergrund. Wir fördern eine vielfältige und inklusive Unternehmenskultur, feiern gemeinsame Erfolge, und stärken unser Teamgefühl durch regelmäßige Team-Events, Team-Meetings und Team-Lunches.
  • Empowering Company Culture: Arbeite in einem zukunftsorientierten Unternehmen mit modernem Office im Herzen Berlins. Bei uns kannst Du Deine Ideen einbringen und umsetzen, dank flacher Hierarchien und schnellen Entscheidungswegen.
  • Broad Range of Projects: Tauche ein in eine Welt spannender, vielseitiger Projekte, die nicht nur Deine Verantwortungsbereiche erweitern, sondern auch sinnvoll und erfüllend sind. Bei uns findest Du Arbeit, die Sinn macht.
  • Fast Application Process: Erwarte einen schnellen Bewerbungsprozess mit umgehendem Feedback und regelmäßigen Status-Updates. Wir halten Dich auf dem Laufenden und schätzen Deine Zeit und Dein Engagement.
  • Warm Welcome & Structured Onboarding: Starte durch mit unserem strukturierten Onboarding-Prozess, inklusive Mentoring, Briefings und Welcome-Days. Wir sorgen dafür, dass Du Dich von Anfang an als Teil des Teams fühlst.

Title: UI Path Entwickler m/f/d
Description:
Positionstitel: UiPath Entwickler (m/w/d)

Gehalt: €60.000 - €75.000 jährlich

Bereich: IT, Technologie, Beratung

Location: Berlin

UiPath Entwickler (m/w/d) – Berlin (Deutsch auf C1-Niveau erforderlich)

Ein innovatives Tech-Startup in Berlin sucht nach einem erfahrenen UiPath Entwickler (m/w/d), der das Team verstärkt und maßgeschneiderte Automatisierungslösungen für anspruchsvolle Geschäftsprozesse entwickelt.

Deine Aufgaben


Entwicklung und Test von automatisierten Prozessen mit UiPath
Enge Zusammenarbeit mit verschiedenen Teams zur Identifizierung von Automatisierungspotenzialen
Unterstützung und Coaching des Teams in Bezug auf bewährte Methoden und hohe Qualitätsstandards
Optimierung von Entwicklungsprozessen und ständige Verbesserung operativer Abläufe
Mitarbeit in einem agilen Umfeld mit SCRUM und DevOps-Methoden
Förderung neuer RPA-Initiativen und Innovationsprojekte


Dein Profil


Mindestens 2 Jahre Berufserfahrung in der Entwicklung von RPA-Lösungen (UiPath, BluePrism, AutomationAnywhere, PowerAutomate, Robocorp)
Erfahrung mit agilen Methoden wie SCRUM und der Nutzung von GIT oder TFS
Abgeschlossenes Studium in Wirtschaftsinformatik, Informatik oder einer vergleichbaren Fachrichtung
Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse (mindestens C1-Niveau)
Strukturierte und teamorientierte Arbeitsweise


Zusätzliche Qualifikationen


Kenntnisse in objektorientierter Programmierung (C#, Java oder Python)
Erfahrung in den Bereichen Testautomatisierung, künstliche Intelligenz oder Machine Learning von Vorteil


Wir Bieten Dir


Attraktives Gehaltspaket mit Bonuszahlungen
Flexibles Arbeitszeitmodell mit hybrider Arbeitsweise (3 Tage im Büro, 2 Tage Home-Office)
30 Urlaubstage sowie Workation- und Sabbatical-Optionen
Mitgliedschaft im Urban Sports Club und Unterstützung bei der Mobilität (Jobticket)
Umfangreiche Weiterbildungs- und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten


Bewerbungsprozess

Unser Bewerbungsprozess ist schlank und umfasst drei Schritte: Ein erstes Gespräch mit HR, eine technische Aufgabe (Coding-Challenge) und ein finales Interview vor Ort.

Du möchtest Teil eines zukunftsorientierten und dynamischen Unternehmens sein, das die digitale Transformation aktiv vorantreibt? Dann bewirb dich jetzt!

Kontakt

Ralph Biedermann

Consultant | DATA & AI | Permanent Solutions

Email: r.biedermann@zabelglobal.com

Telefon: +49 170 653 91 01

Website: www.zabelglobal.com

Title: Data Analytics Scientist (w/m/d)
Description:
We are Billie, the leading provider of Buy Now, Pay Later (BNPL) payment methods for businesses, offering B2B companies innovative digital payment services and modern checkout solutions. We are to create a new standard for business payments and have made it our mission to simplify the purchasing experience for all businesses making it a tool for growth. Our solutions are based on proprietary, machine-learning-supported risk models, fully digitized processes and a highly scalable tech platform. This makes us a deep-tech company building financial products, not the other way around. We love building simple and elegant solutions and we strive for automation and scalability.

About The Role

Billie’s Analytics team is at the heart of the company supporting multiple functions to make data-driven decisions. The Analytics team works closely with all Product segments, and other departments by innovating, hypothesizing, strategizing and providing recommended actions to relevant stakeholders (Decision Science, Business Development and Account Management, Collection and Underwriting teams, Customer support and Marketing) in an integrated, scalable, secure and compliant way to enable the company's sustainable growth.

We are looking for a Data Scientist to join Billie’s Analytics team and contribute to the development and enhancement of Billie’s analytical capabilities.

In this role, you will have the chance to make a significant impact by leveraging data and analytics tools, will look for solutions, establish relationships to be able to guide business decisions within the company values and expectations, and contribute to the ongoing growth of our portfolio.

As a Data Scientist at Billie, your role involves diving into our data to solve crucial business problems. The scope of this role ranges from diagnosing problem areas to identifying solutions to designing experiments and ultimately influencing decision-making. This is a rare, operational and actionable data-driven experience that requires a good mix of technical and stakeholder engagement skills. As part of the Analytics team, you will be driving action from the frontlines, owning the business outcome, rather than just doing yet another analytics or data science role.

This is a unique opportunity for data scientists who are eager to immerse themselves in the heart of the fintech business, develop additional muscles, and grow within a fast-paced and dynamic environment. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, apply creative problem-solving skills, and drive business growth through data-driven strategies.

What will you do?


Perform analysis to develop a deep understanding of the product, and its usage, business processes, and to support business and research hypotheses, including A/B testing of product ideas, identifying new product and business opportunities
Find patterns in huge amounts of data
Support product segments in asking the right questions and creating efficient solutions that deliver positive results
Design data models as part of data solution to support reporting and analysis needs
Perform comprehensive data analysis and EDA to support Risk and Fraud systems optimization
Build ML models to solve real business problems, and work closely with MLOps and Engineering teams to bring them live
Communicate and present recommendations and key insights to stakeholders and executives to drive business decisions and create an impact
Communicate issues in an independent and timely manner with appropriate internal and external partners


Who We Are Looking For


You have 5+ years of proven experience in data science, data engineering or quantitative analytics
Proficiency in writing structured and efficient SQL queries for large data sets
Expertise in statistical analysis, including hypothesis testing, experimentation using statistical software packages in Python, R, or equivalent
Proven track record of managing complex initiatives with strong emphasis on data, providing actionable insights and tracking success of those initiatives
Able to communicate complex problems in a simple and relevant manner at all levels
Experience with translating analytical insights into data driven business prioritization
You have strong business acumen coupled with highly analytical mindset
You had the chance to work in a fast-paced and dynamic environment
Strong sense of responsibility, self-starter, well organized, good planner, able to work independently and meet deadlines
Previously experience in a fraud, risk & payment management environment is an advantage


What We Offer


Flexible work hours and trust in your ability to deliver, empowering you to take control of your work-life balance
Hybrid working approach enabling a good balance working from home and the office
One of the best Virtual Shares Incentive Programs in the market, so that everyone at Billie is invested in our success
Our “Catch a Ride with Billie” program, that enables discounted access to Berlin Public Transport (BVG)
A yearly development budget to broaden your skill set and horizons
Free German group classes
An English-speaking, multicultural team with more than 46 nationalities
Great office space at Checkpoint Charlie with free gym access, barista coffee, drinks and more


Billie offers you the opportunity to be a part of one of the fastest-growing Fintech startups in Europe following the mission to innovate to create new freedom for businesses of all sizes. Our combined decades of experience in B2B Financing and Payments in a market thirsty for innovation and change make this a fantastic possibility to get into the most dynamic space in tech.

Join an international team of talented, passionate people where drive and merit matter. We work in nimble, cross-functional teams with open communication lines across the company. You’ll be surrounded by smart people from a wide variety of backgrounds from which you can learn and that want to learn from you.

Are you ready to join Billie?

Billie is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment in our workplace. By embracing talents and abilities of all kinds, we aim to boost motivation and team creativity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, national origin, age, marital status, gender, political views, beliefs, sexual orientation, color, disability status, or any other demographic factors.
Show more

Title: Senior Data Scientist - Fraud & Credit Risk (m/f/d)
Description:
About the job




Ratepay is a leading financial technology company specializing in providing innovative payment solutions for online businesses. With a mission to simplify payment processes and enhance the shopping experience for customers, Ratepay empowers merchants to optimize their payment strategies and drive business growth.




Founded with a focus on innovation and customer satisfaction, Ratepay offers a comprehensive suite of payment solutions tailored to the needs of modern e-commerce businesses. From flexible installment options to seamless checkout experiences, Ratepay's solutions are designed to increase conversion rates, reduce cart abandonment, and foster long-term customer loyalty.




Your mission




Risk management is at the core of Ratepay’s business strategy. Our cutting-edge risk management platform processes hundreds of thousands of transactions daily, ensuring secure payments for our merchants and their customers while minimizing risk and maximizing profitability.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Full-Stack Data Scientist to take a leading role in enhancing our fraud prevention and credit risk assessment capabilities. This role involves researching, developing, and deploying advanced machine learning algorithms into production. You will be responsible for every aspect of the data science process, from data collection and pre-processing to building and deploying machine learning models, as well as developing and maintaining production-level codebases.

In this role, you will collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive innovation and ensure that our solutions are scalable and reliable in a fast-paced environment.




Your tasks at Ratepay, among others




Lead the research, development and implementation of advanced machine learning models for credit risk assessment and fraud prevention.
Own data science projects end-to-end, i.e. from ideation and proof of concept to bringing it into production.
Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code adhering to best engineering practices for data processing, model development, and deployment, ensuring scalability and reliability.
Pre-process complex financial data and create ETL pipelines to support machine learning models.
Continuously improve our machine learning workflows, research, and deployment pipelines, ensuring best practices and innovation.
Collaborate closely with team members and cross-functional teams, utilizing strong communication skills to develop robust machine learning solutions.
Take ownership of subcomponents of the machine learning infrastructure, ensuring their performance and scalability as the platform evolves.







That's what you bring along




5 + years of experience working with the whole data science product cycle: conception, research, prototyping, modelling, deployment to production
Master’s degree in STEM field
Very good engineering skills in Python and familiarity with clean code (pre-commit, black, code reviews etc.), unit testing (pytest) and type hints (mypy).
General understanding of SQL and SQL databases. Ability to retrieve data and build data pipelines that feed models in research and (ideally) build pipelines for production.
Advanced knowledge of statistical learning theory and its application to solve real-world problems.
Strong stakeholder communication skills with the ability to clearly present ideas, solutions and findings.




Nice to have:




MLOps and experience on AWS Cloud
Experience in Fintech







Equal Opportunities & Diversity

We value our diversity and welcome everyone to our team. Regardless of ethnic and social background, religious views, worldview, gender, sexual orientation, physical and mental limitations, age, marital status, educational background and nationality. With over 250 employees and 40 different nationalities, we take our values seriously. These include; ownership, growth, integrity, collaboration, customer centricity and inclusion (4/6 of our C-Level Board members are female).

Show more

Title: Graduate Computer Science, Full Stack Developer AWS, Autonomous Drones, Berlin
Description:
We are protecting industrial areas with autonomous drones and are looking for a full stack developer for our AWS based Cloud Software. You are close to finishing your studies, or you recently finished your studies and are looking for a job? You are reliable and a teamplayer?

Tasks


Development of our Cloud Software to control drones


Requirements

Must have


Experience with TypeScript, NestJS
Experience with GraphQL, Apollo server

Title: Junior Data Scientist
Description:
About the job







BIP is the international consultancy for the 21st century with over 5,000 consultants globally daring to make a difference.




Operating at the intersection of business and technology, we design, develop, and deliver sustainable solutions at pace and scale, creating greater value for customers, employees, shareholders and society.




As a Certified B Corporation, we believe in conducting business for the greater good. We embrace all aspects of corporate social responsibility in a way that permeates everything we do, including not only the way we interact with our own people but with our various communities as well as the environment.




BIP. Here To Dare.




About the role




Working hand in hand with our Business Consultants and Data Architects, you will help delivering the finest offerings for analytics, data science and machine learning.




Your Data Scientist role as member of the xTech Centre of Excellence at BIP will involve:




Supporting customers to understand how to improve their businesses using the right AI offerings.
Listening and identifying the client's requirements.
Delivering projects based on our data science offerings.
Interact with software developers and architects internally as part of our global xTech community, with client suppliers and staff
Combine strategic and analytical thinking in relation to business, product, and technical challenges, with the ability to build and convey compelling value propositions.




This role is a Hybrid role, the successful person will need to be flexible to travel to client sites as required and have the ability to travel to London 1-2 times per month for team and company events.







Requirements:




Bip UK are a disability confident employer, and we interview every disabled applicant (As defined in the Equality Act 2010) that meets the minimum criteria for the job:




Basic understanding of Data Science and light data development skills—you will need to be able to deliver technical content and at the same time bridge that technical knowledge with business discussions in non-jargon language.
Basic experience in a Data Analytics role (Data Science, Data Analytics or ML).







Additional requirements







Quantitative degree (i.e., Maths, Statistics, Physics, Engineering or Data Science).
A can-do attitude that always puts the customers first and helps gain the position of Trusted Advisor.
Experience working with Agile frameworks is considered a plus.
Experience in Data Visualisation and Data engineering is considered a plus.
Proven experience working with customer data & personalisation
An understanding of and experience with machine learning techniques is considered a plus.
Ability to communicate complex concepts to a broad range of audiences in a simple way
Entrepreneurial spirit & proactiveness







Benefits:




Hybrid working options with monthly budgets for NearU for local office day booking and team meetings.
Bip UK recognises and values its diversity and is committed to offering family-friendly employment policies including enhanced maternity and paternity pay
A diverse and skilled workforce within a collaborative, team-based environment
Profit share and discretionary performance bonus based on personal performance
Comprehensive private medical for staff + Medicash top up plan (option to include dependants)
Employer contribution pension of 6%
25 days annual leave, plus bank holidays and a volunteering day. Also buy up to 5 additional days holiday or sell up to 3 days per year.
Employee Assistance Programme. Company paid 24x7 helpline, online portal and confidential counselling to support staff with any work and / or personal issues
Corporate discounted benefits such as gym and health assessment
Death in service/Life insurance
Eyecare Voucher
Lifestyle change Gift Voucher
Long service reward
Recruitment referral bonus paid for successful referrals
Training and development opportunities to support your career and personal development




*Note the above contains current benefit offerings - these are kept under review and are subject to change or enhancement.




Real world, real work, and real value, that’s the Bip UK commitment on every transformation we do. We deliver good-sense, human-centred strategies, that produce the results. We understand the possibilities can seem endless. Challenges are complex, technology ever evolving, and business goals pressurised and diverse.




Bip UK believes in conducting business for the greater good. We embrace all aspects of corporate social responsibility in a way that permeates everything we do, including not only the way we interact with our own people but with our various communities as well as the environment

Title: Data Science Graduate
Description:
Company Description

Fascinated by the future and captivated by technology?

Smart, driven and want to make a difference in the world?

You’ll fit right in.

Join a diverse team at Visa, where your individuality fits right in. We can provide the opportunity to shape the payments experience globally. Together, let’s transform the way the world pays.

Think you know us?

Our mission is to connect the world through the most innovative, reliable and secure digital payment network that enables individuals, businesses and economies to thrive.

Individuality fuels our brand and our global team — we’re proud to be a talented team of 15,000 individuals with unique backgrounds, perspectives and experiences. We understand that you are much more than your day job. We encourage quality of life outside of the office: whether it’s taking advantage of agile working schedules or our wellness programmes, Visa respects and encourages meaningful work/life balance for everyone. In addition, we offer market-leading compensation and have a fantastic benefits offering.

So, if you’re not satisfied with the status quo, we can satisfy your desire to explore new territory, giving you the runway to really make an impact, whilst connecting you with teams around the world in a truly inclusive culture that celebrates our uniqueness.

Job Description

What we expect of you, day to day:

The Data Scientist graduate is a key member of the client facing Data Science Lab team in the European region. As a Data Scientist, you will be accountable for the development and delivery of analytics driven strategies and solutions for Visa’s external clients in Europe. In this role, you will work collaboratively with VCA and a multitude of internal functions, their senior leaders and our clients in promoting insights driven culture, creative and cutting edge analytic solutions and best practices to drive business performance with a clear commercial ‘value’ and measurable ‘return’. Half of your day will involve delivering project (coding/working with data) and the other half will be dedicated to discussing data requirements, managing internal and external meetings. Please bear in mind that our workload varies tremendously given each project is very bespoke, sometimes we might be delivering a csv file, another time a predictive machine learning model or segmentation. Whatever the solution is, you will be involved in the end to end process starting from gathering clients requirements all the way to delivering actionable insight enabling our clients to make data driven business decisions.

Principal Responsibilities


Evangelizes the creative use of data science to solve business problems with external clients 
Works with VCA consultants in market to drive data science business development opportunities across key accounts to meet VCA revenue targets
Applies data science and predictive techniques that can be used to enhance client profitability across acquisition and retention
Works with VCA consultants on conducting VisaNet data analysis on key metrics in order to articulate key issuer P&L opportunities to drive revenue growth for our clients and Visa
Create and deliver powerful business-centric insights from data through better visualization and storyboarding
Collaborating with the internal and external partners to fully understand business requirements and desired business outcomes
Execution proficiency in handling multiple medium to large data science projects along with rest of the stakeholders in the project team
Defining detailed analytic scope and methodology, and creating analytic plans
Executing on the analytic plans with appropriate data mining and statistical techniques
Ensuring project delivery within timelines and budget requirements
Ensuring all project documentation is up to date and all projects are reviewed per analytic plan
Enhancing existing solutions and approaches by promoting new methodology and best practices in data science field
Providing subject matter expertise and quality assurance of complex data science projects
Automating processes/codes
Familiarising yourself with new tools/software/techniques


Qualifications

What we’re after…


Graduate/Post Graduate degree (Masters or Ph.D.) in Quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Operational Research, Computer Science, Economics, or engineering or equivalent experience .
Graduating in 2025.
Results oriented with strong analytical, consultative and problem-solving skills, with demonstrated intellectual and analytical rigor
Familiarity with modern distributed systems, including both Hadoop/SQL/MLP and Apache Spark etc.
Familiarity with one or more data analytics/programming tools such as R or Python
Knowledge of applying predictive modelling and machine learning technique to problems
Ability to communicate with impact and interest in working in a consulting-like environment and client-facing project roles


Additional Information

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

  • Applies data science and predictive techniques that can be used to enhance client profitability across acquisition and retention
  • Works with VCA consultants on conducting VisaNet data analysis on key metrics in order to articulate key issuer P&L opportunities to drive revenue growth for our clients and Visa
